result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan L Farnam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan L Farnam is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dylan L Farnam was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber allowed.    Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $100.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges &    Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100.00  ea applicable count).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Perform 100 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May Not have contact with Nina Rivera unless otherwise permitted by the court.  Deft may expunge his record upon successfully completing probation and fine & costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan L Farnam

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Dylan L Farnam, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 60 days in the KCJ with Huber privileges;  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.  As a condition he is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.  No contact with Nina R.  Fined $100 plus costs and Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  DE may expunge record upon successfully completing all conditions of probation including fine & costs.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

1:22 pm    Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk:  LE.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of not guilty entered by the Court.  PTC 1-30-15 @ 2:40 & FPT 3-5-15 @ 8:40 am.  $650 contd posted cash bond set with conditions.

Continued Posted
  *No Contact w/ Nina R, April M or their residences.
940.19(1) Battery, DV   /   947.01(1) DC, DV
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Phan
and witness list filed by the State
